avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. There are isolated danger spots. These are located in high, shady, very steep entrances to gullies and hollows. Small slab avalanches can be triggered here in drifting snow, particularly due to high additional loads. In addition to the risk of burial, the danger of being swept away and falling should also be taken into account.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger - fresh snow covering the meadows.

snowpackStructure.comment: There is still more or less continuous snow cover only at high altitudes and on the shaded side. Exposed terrain forms are mostly blown off and bare or icy, only in hollow forms such as gullies and hollows does an old snow cover exist, which is weakened in places by angular crystals. Fresh snow (10 to 20 cm) is deposited on the layers described, some of which is transported.

tendency.highlights: Wednesday will be sunny and warmer again. The snow cover may settle.

weatherForecast.comment: On Tuesday, an Italian low will bring very cloudy and wet weather to the Styrian mountains. Snowfall will start early in the morning in the Totes Gebirge and spread towards the peripheral mountains as the day progresses. The snow line in the north will often drop into the valleys, in the south it will only start to snow above 1500m, in the afternoon it may snow down to around 700m. The wind will shift to the west to northwest and it will no longer be so stormy with gusts of between 30 and 50 km/h. At 2000m it will cool down to minus 7 degrees in the north and minus 4 degrees in the south.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is rated as moderate above the tree line. Attention must be paid to the drift snow and old snow problem. The danger spots are in the north and east sectors. It cannot be completely ruled out that a snow slab can be triggered with a small additional load. In places, avalanches can tear through an persistent weak layers
avalancheActivity.highlights: Beware of fresh drift snow at high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: At high altitudes, the old snow surface is usually hard and icy. Under the hard layer, the accumulating transformation weakens the snowpack foundation. The tnew snow (up to 20 cm) is deposited on a hard snow layer or, on the north side, on a soft layer, depending on the exposure and altitude. The bonding of the fresh snow or drifting snow layer will not be sufficient. In general, the snow cover is very unevenly distributed, with little snow from the middle elevations downwards.

tendency.highlights: On Wednesday, the high-altitude current will turn back to the west. This means that the clouds in Styria will clear again during the course of the day and make way for sunshine. Rain and snowfall have already subsided during the night and Wednesday will be dry. The avalanche danger remains the same.

weatherForecast.comment: On Tuesday, an Italian low will bring very cloudy and wet weather to the Styrian mountains. Snowfall will start early in the morning in the Totes Gebirge and spread towards the peripheral mountains as the day progresses. The snow line in the north will often drop into the valleys, in the south it will only start to snow above 1500m, in the afternoon it may snow down to around 700m. The wind will shift to the west to northwest and it will no longer be so stormy with gusts of between 30 and 50 km/h. At 2000m it will cool down to minus 7 degrees in the north and minus 4 degrees in the south.

customData.generalHeadline: Fresh snow in the high altitudes! Partially fresh drift snow!
